items.sentence: Where I come from, people don\'t do things like that.
Tom almost never does what he says he\'s going to do.
I\'ve got no place to go, so I\'m going to stay here.
I\'ve met a lot of people who don\'t like doing that.
I can\'t do without an air conditioner in the summer.
I didn\'t have anything to do with Tom getting fired.
I want to know what happened to the gun Tom gave you.
I wanted to have a word with you about what happened.
Tom already has enough money to buy a new motorcycle.
Tom always dresses in black or some other dark color.
Tom always drinks his coffee black and without sugar.
Tom always gets nervous just before he goes on stage.
Tom always seems to find something to complain about.
Anyone over eighteen years of age counts as an adult.
Did you believe in Santa Claus when you were a child?
I see these flowers everywhere. What are they called?
Why didn\'t you tell me you\'d already told Tom that?
You really should be packing your suitcase right now.
Do you know why Tom didn\'t invite Mary to his party?
We are twins. People often mistake me for my brother.
I can\'t concentrate on my work because of the noise.
I can\'t figure out how to delete what I just posted.
I can\'t imagine what life would be like without you.
I\'d like a chance to explain why I made this choice.
I\'d like you to look after my dog during my absence.
I don\'t have a shovel, but I know somebody who does.
I don\'t intend to have anything more to do with Tom.
I don\'t know when Tom and Mary plan to go to Boston.
I still can\'t believe I\'m going to be on your team.
I still don\'t understand why you\'d want to do that.
I can\'t wait to see Tom\'s face when Mary gets here.
I\'m meeting Tom for lunch at Chuck\'s Bar and Grill.
It\'s already 2:30 and Tom and Mary aren\'t here yet.
Tom and Mary spent a year traveling around the world.

Tom and Mary split a bottle of red wine after dinner.

Tom and Mary talked about what they were going to do.
Tom and Mary took their children to Boston with them.
Luckily, both of the drivers were wearing seat belts.
Many flights have been canceled because of the storm.
Mary asked her friends if they thought Tom liked her.
I got up earlier than usual to catch the first train.
I had hardly left home when it began to rain heavily.
I hope that neither of them was injured in the crash.
I can\'t remember the last time I ate with my family.
I couldn\'t hear what was happening in the next room.
I didn\'t have to pay for the plane ticket to Boston.
It\'s easy to understand why people don\'t trust Tom.
I\'m surprised Tom doesn\'t know how to speak French.
I thought it might be fun, so I went to Tom\'s party.
I thought maybe you\'d found out something about Tom.
Tom was the last person I expected to meet in Boston.
Tom was the one who taught me how to play the guitar.
I can\'t believe that you\'re really in love with me.
Tom and Mary are both very generous with their money.
Tom and Mary both graduated from the same university.
Tom and Mary have longer holidays than their parents.
Tom and Mary looked at each other through the window.
Tom doesn\'t think he has the time to help you today.
Tom doesn\'t understand how that could have happened.
Tom explained to Mary why he wasn\'t able to do that.
Tom and Mary are going to climb Mt. Fuji next summer.
Tom and Mary have been married for about three years.
Is there any chance that Tom won\'t get here on time?
I want you to tell me everything you know about that.
I wanted to go out and play baseball with my friends.
I warned Tom not to pitch his tent so near the river.
Tom has already told Mary what to bring to the party.
Tom hugged Mary and gave her a long, passionate kiss.
I wish I could figure out how to control my appetite.
Almost all of the reviews of the play were favorable.
Are you still not able to communicate well in French?
At that time, I had no idea what was going to happen.
Do you really want me to tell Tom about you and Mary?
Some eggs weren\'t rotten, but the rest of them were.

Tom apparently hasn\'t told Mary about what happened.
Tom asked Mary a question she didn\'t want to answer.
Tom didn\'t begin to write songs until he was thirty.

I don\'t think that we should leave the windows open.
I don\'t think that you should borrow money from Tom.
I don\'t think the pain will ever completely go away.
Why does the phone always ring when I\'m in the bath?
Tom told me he was going to help me with my homework.
Tom lives in a small town on the outskirts of Boston.
Tom told me to meet him in front of the concert hall.

Tom certainly has had more than one job offer by now.
Tom certainly seems to be good at playing the guitar.
Tom chopped down the tree that was behind the garage.
Tom chopped down the tree that was in our front yard.
Why have you been late to school every day this week?
Why is it that many language courses are ineffective?
Will your report be finished in time for the meeting?
Would it be faster to get there by taxi or by subway?

Tom wasn\'t strong enough to lift the box by himself.
